page.title: 05ASHPERTON PARK: OLD WOODLAND
page.content: Ashperton Park is situated in the south of the Parish of Ashperton, covering almost 48\ acres of mainly deciduous woodland, traversed by many pathways. It is bordered in the east by the main A417 road and in the North, South and East by farmland. Notable flora and fauna include deer, said to have been introduced within the last ten years, fox, badger, grey squirrel, great spotted woodpecker, pygmy shrew, and common spotted orchid. The trees are mainly hardwood of Oak, some Beech, Birch and Chestnut. The west end near Woodend has been replanted in recent years with coniferous trees. The latest felled area has been replanted with oak saplings. Until this year the shooting rights have been on an annual basis. The wood was stocked with pheasant and pathways kept clear.
